text: test

may want to ride the High Seas vocal loops down in level when the lead vocal is happening, as if we're passing through waves of sound. Can also sound more ethereal/otherworldy, more like a loop or sample than a vocal part we should focus on. Fading in and out noticeably would be OK, even some auto-panning maybe.
Taylor has a descending vocal line here that we'd like to hear more clearly

General - Clean "gunslinger" guitars could use a little more saturation/sparkle. Sounds a little too DI-ish. Could also drop the level of those guitars slightly and automate them up in gaps, kind of a wave-like motion.
Can we try a long-ish reverse reverb to kind of "swoop" into the first lead vocal line of verse 1, over that dynamic drop?

General - lead vocals and guitars could use some more aggression. Lead vocal could use less going on in the low end and more saturation, partway to a telephone sound but not all the way. Lead vocal can also come down a tiny bit relative to the track, as long as we can still pick out the lyrics. Taylor's vocal sound could go airier/lighter, maybe filter out more lows & pull down in level a little bit.
Right after "can't stop" and before "can't drop it," can we try muting everything in between those two lines, including reverb? Just go to digital black for a short moment right there.
Can we make that harsh-ish lead guitar even more loud, almost annoying? It can compete with the vocal a little, that's OK.
here
Can we make the footsteps go from right to left across the stereo field?
Losing the bass on smaller systems right here, "when it comes to the end of the world," which makes it harder to identify the chord. It's OK on larger speakers.

There's the sound of bare feet walking across the room, these should start pretty far right and pan to the left until the thud sound hit's.  The idea is a guy getting up out of bed with a window on his right  and walking across the room only to fall over and faceplant on the floorboards.
Could we try making the vocal in your face and maybe lose the reverb/room just for "thing you can feel that can't be seen?"  Might sound weird, but then again it might sound cool,
Yes, I feel like the guitar needs to be a counterpoint to the lead vocal and slam in there- especially on lines like "fast fast fast"
Guitar can be VERY in your face and aggressive here- it follows the vocal down.  As long as we don't lose the vocal that should sound cool, same for the parts right after that.
Yes and there's a keyboard note from the track Boomwacker that hands over into that 1 beat gap between Cant stop (error note) can't drop it.  My mistake on the keys. I blame Imogen Heap.
Yeah, less creepy little girl and more kind of shoegazer cool.

General Note.  The first mix is super good already, I've listened in multiple situations and so has brian- here are our comments on what is already a really great result.  What I would really like is for you to just go to 11 on everything- just emphasizing the etherial in the intro and making the verses as punchy and aggressive as possible.  If ever for a moment you feel bored perhaps pull something into focus or add an effect.  I'm just giving general idea- the specific ones are  already noted.  I really really really dig what you did at the end of the song- so I'm asking for the gloves off mix- anything goes that you think will make it paint the best picture.  For example- if you think one of the guitars needs to be axed completely from the end or something like that- go ahead with my blessing.  My thought is go nuts on this rev, and that may be it- we may be done, or maybe we just back off a little and meet in the middle and we're totally done.  But now is a good time to get nuts and have fun with it.  Also, I think on this song slamming the hell out of it (or jus a bit more maybe, might be ok in the master- I'm not sure- just a thought.   All that being said- I have said my peace and I know it's gona turn out great.
Yes, and maybe the high seas vocal "loop could echo into the distance with a delay that degrades into a feedback loop as part of that transition.
can we bump the "voices in my head" stuff up just a bit?
Drums note. Maybe when Matt does a cool fill like that it could be be bumped up a tiny bit
Just need to be sure that On and on (Taylor) and on is still understandable underneath the other vocal (me) who's sayin "on" held out longer.
